verses.text:
You have given us as sheep for food,
and among the nations you have scattered us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have sold your people cheaply,
and did not profit by their price.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have made us a taunt to our neighbors,
a derision and a scorn to those around us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have made us a byword among the nations,
a shaking of the head among the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All day long my disgrace is before me,
and the shame of my face covers me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because of the voice of the taunter and the reviler,
because of the enemy and the avenger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All this has befallen us, though we have not forgotten you,
and we have not been false to your covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our heart has not turned back,
and our steps have not turned aside from your way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you have crushed us in a place of jackals,
and have covered us with deep shadow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If we had forgotten the name of our God,
or had spread out our hands in prayer to a foreign god,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
would not God discover this,
for he knows the secrets of the heart?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rather, on account of you we are killed all day long;
we are accounted as sheep for slaughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wake up! Why do you sleep, O Lord?
Awake! Do not reject forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do you hide your face?
Have you forgotten our misery and our oppression?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For our soul is bowed down to the dust.
Our body clings to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rise up! Be a help for us,
and redeem us for the sake of your loyal love.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Gird your sword on your thigh, O mighty one,
in your splendor and your majesty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And in your majesty ride victoriously,
because of truth and humility and righteousness.
And let your right hand teach you awesome deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Your throne, O God, is forever and ever.
A scepter of uprightness is
the scepter of your kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You love righteousness and hate wickedness.
Therefore God, your God, has anointed you
from among your companions with festive oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All your robes are scented with myrrh and aloes and cassia.
From palaces of ivory stringed instruments gladden you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Kings’ daughters are among your noble ladies.
The queen stands at your right hand in gold of Ophir.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear, O daughter, and discern and incline your ear,
and forget your people and your father’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the king desire your beauty.
Because he is your lord, therefore bow down to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even the daughter of Tyre will come with a gift.
The rich from among people will seek your favor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The king’s daughter is all glorious within;
her garment is of gold embroidered cloth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She is brought to the king in colorful garments.
The young women behind her, her attendants,
are being brought to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are led with joy and gladness.
They enter the palace of the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In place of your fathers will be your sons.
You will make them princes in all the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will cause your name to be remembered in all generations;
therefore peoples will praise you forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God is our refuge and strength,
a very sufficient help in troubles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore we will not fear though the earth change,
and though the mountains totter into the midst of the sea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
though its waters roar and foam,
though mountains shake with its surging water. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is a river whose streams gladden the city of God,
the holiest of the dwellings of the Most High.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Nations roar, kingdoms shake;
he utters his voice, the earth melts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh of hosts is with us;
our high stronghold is the God of Jacob. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Come, see the works of Yahweh,
who has placed desolations on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh of Hosts is with us;
the God of Jacob is our high stronghold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All you peoples, clap your hands.
Shout to God with a voice of rejoicing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For Yahweh Most High is awesome,
a great king over all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He subdues peoples under us
and nations under our feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He chooses for us our inheritance,
the pride of Jacob whom he loves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God has gone up with a shout,
Yahweh with the sound of a trumpet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing praises to God, sing praises.
Sing praises to our king, sing praises.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For God is king of all the earth.
Sing praises with understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God reigns over nations;
God sits on his holy throne.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The princes of the peoples are gathered together
with the people of Abraham’s God.
For the shields of the earth belong to God.
He is very exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh is great and very worthy of praise
in the city of our God, in his holy mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Beautiful in elevation, the joy of the whole earth,
is Mount Zion, in the far north,
the city of the great king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God is in her citadels;
he is known as a high stronghold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For see, the kings assembled;
they advanced together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They themselves saw it, so they were astonished.
They were terrified; they ran off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Trembling seized them there—
pain as of a woman in labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With an east wind
you shatter the ships of Tarshish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As we have heard, so we have seen
in the city of Yahweh of hosts, in the city of our God.
God will establish her forever. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We have pondered your loyal love, O God,
in the midst of your temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As is your name, O God, so is your praise
to the ends of the earth.
Your right hand is full of righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Walk about Zion and circle it;
count her towers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Consider well her ramparts.
Go through her citadels
so that you can tell the next generation
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that this is God, our God forever and ever.
He himself will guide us until death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear this, all you peoples;
give ear, all you inhabitants of the world,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
both low and high,
rich and poor together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My mouth will speak wisdom,
and the meditation of my heart will be understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will incline my ear to a proverb;
I will propound my riddle on a lyre.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why should I fear in times of calamity,
when iniquity surrounds me at my heels,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
those who trust their wealth
and boast about the abundance of their riches?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely a man cannot redeem a brother.
He cannot give to God his ransom
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
(since the redemption price for their life is costly
and it always fails),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so that he may stay alive forever
and not see the pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he sees that the wise die,
together with the fool and brute they perish,
and leave their wealth to the next generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Within them they think their houses are forever,
their dwelling places from generation to generation.
They name their lands by their own names.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But man cannot continue in his pomp.
He is like the beasts that perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is the journey of those who have foolish confidence,
and those after them who accept their sayings. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like sheep they are destined to Sheol;
death will shepherd them.
But the upright will rule over them in the morning,
and their forms will be for Sheol to consume,
far from his lofty abode.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Do not fear when a man becomes rich,
when the wealth of his house increases,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because when he dies he will not take away any of it.
His wealth will not follow down after him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though he congratulated his soul while he was living
—and people will praise you when you do well for yourself—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
it will go to the generation of his fathers.
Never will they see light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Humankind in its pomp, but does not understand,
is like the beasts that perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Supreme God, God, Yahweh, has spoken
and summoned the earth,
from the rising of the sun
to its setting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From Zion, the perfection of beauty,
God shines forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our God comes and he is not silent.
Before him fire devours,
and around him it is very tempestuous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He summons the heavens above
and the earth that he might judge his people:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Gather to me my loyal ones,
those who have made a covenant with me by sacrifice.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the heavens declare his righteousness,
because God himself is judge. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Hear, O my people, and I will speak,
O Israel, and I will testify against you.
I am God, your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is not concerning a lack of your sacrifices that I rebuke you,
and your burnt offerings are before me continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will not take from your house a bull
or from your stalls a he-goat,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because every animal of the forest is mine,
the cattle on a thousand hills.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I know every bird of the mountains,
and every moving creature in the field is mine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I were hungry I would not tell you,
because the world and its fullness are mine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do I eat the flesh of bulls
or drink the blood of goats?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Offer to God a thank offering
and pay your vows to the Most High.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And call me in the day of trouble;
I will deliver you, and you will glorify me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But to the wicked God says,
“What right have you to recite my statutes
and mention my covenant with your mouth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
while you yourself hate discipline,
and cast my words behind you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When you see a thief, then you are pleased with him,
and your association is with adulterers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You give your mouth free rein for evil,
and you harness your tongue to deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You sit and speak against your brother;
you slander your mother’s son.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Now consider this, you who forget God,
lest I tear you apart, and there will be none to deliver.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Be gracious to me, O God, according to your loyal love.
According to your abundant mercies,
blot out my transgressions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wash me thoroughly from my iniquity,
and from my sin cleanse me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I myself know my transgressions,
and my sin is ever before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Against you, only you, I have sinned
and have done this evil in your eyes,
so that you are correct when you speak,
you are blameless when you judge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, in iniquity I was born,
and in sin my mother conceived me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, you delight in truth in the inward parts,
and in the hidden parts you make me to know wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Purify me with hyssop, and I shall be clean.
Wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make me hear joy and gladness;
let the bones you have crushed rejoice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hide your face from my sins,
and all my iniquities blot out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Create a clean heart for me, O God,
and renew a steadfast spirit within me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not cast me away from your presence,
and do not take your Holy Spirit from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Restore to me the joy of your salvation,
and with a willing spirit sustain me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I will teach transgressors your ways,
and sinners will turn back to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, open my lips,
and my mouth will proclaim your praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you do not delight in sacrifice or I would give it.
With a burnt offering you are not pleased.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Do good in your favor toward Zion.
Build the walls of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then you will delight in righteous sacrifices,
burnt offering and whole burnt offering.
Then bulls will be offered on your altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do you boast about evil, O mighty man?
The loyal love of God endures continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your tongue plans destruction,
like a sharp razor, working deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You love evil more than good,
a lie more than speaking what is right. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You love all devouring words,
O deceitful tongue,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but God will pull you down forever.
He will snatch you and tear you away from your tent,
and he will uproot you from the land of the living. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the righteous will see and fear,
and will laugh at him, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But I am like an olive tree flourishing
in the house of God.
I trust the loyal love of God forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will give thanks to you forever, because of what you have done,
and I will wait on your name, because it is good,
in the presence of your faithful ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fool says in his heart, “There is no God.”
They are corrupt and they have done abominable iniquity.
There is none who does good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God looks down from heaven upon the children of humankind
to see whether there is one who has insight,
one who seeks God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All of them have turned back.
They are altogether corrupt.
There is none who does good;
there is not even one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not evildoers know,
they who eat my people as though they were eating bread?
They do not call on God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There they are very fearful
where no fear had been,
because God has scattered the bones of him who encamps against you.
You have put them to shame, because God has rejected them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh, that from Zion would come salvation for Israel!
When God returns the fortunes of his people,
let Jacob rejoice, let Israel be glad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O God, by your name save me,
and by your power vindicate me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O God, hear my prayer;
heed the words of my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For foreigners have risen against me,
and ruthless men seek my life.
They have not set God before them. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
See, God is my helper;
The Lord is with those who sustain my life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will repay my enemies for their evil;
in your faithfulness destroy them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Because he has delivered me from all trouble,
and my eye has looked with satisfaction on my enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give ear, O God, to my prayer,
and do not hide yourself from my plea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Attend to me and answer me.
I am restless in my lamenting and I groan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because of the voice of an enemy,
because of the oppression of the wicked,
because they bring down evil on me,
and in anger they hold a grudge against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My heart trembles within me,
and deathly terrors fall on me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fear and trembling come on me,
and horror overwhelms me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So I say, “Oh, that I had wings like a dove.
I would fly away and be at rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, I would flee far away.
I would dwell in the wilderness. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I would hurry to my refuge
from the raging wind and storm.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Confuse, O Lord; divide their speech,
because I see violence and strife in the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Day and night they go around it on its walls,
and iniquity and trouble are in its midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Destruction is within it,
and oppression and deceit
do not depart from its public square.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For it is not an enemy that taunts me,
or I could bear it.
It is not one who hates me that magnifies himself over me,
or I could hide myself from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But it is you, a man my equal,
my friend and confidant.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Let death deceive them. May they descend to Sheol alive,
because evil is in their home and heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for me, I will call to God,
and Yahweh will save me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Morning, noon and night I will lament and groan loudly,
and he will hear my voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He safely redeems my life from the battle against me,
because those standing against me are among many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God will hear and answer them,
he who is enthroned from of old, Selah
Because they do not change,
and they do not fear God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has put forth his hands against his friends;
he has defiled his covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The buttery words of his mouth were smooth,
but there was battle in his heart.
His words were smoother than oil,
but they were drawn swords.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cast your burden on Yahweh,
and he will sustain you.
He will never allow the righteous to be moved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you, O God, you will bring them down to the pit of corruption.
The men of bloodshed and deceit will not live half their days,
but I will trust you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be gracious to me, O God, because humankind has trampled me;
fighting all the day he oppresses me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My enemies trample all day,
because many are attacking me proudly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I fear, I trust you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God, whose word I praise,
God I trust; I do not fear.
What can mere flesh do to me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All day they twist my words;
all their thoughts are against me for evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They attack, they hide, they watch my steps,
as they lie in wait for my life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because of iniquity will they escape?
In anger cast down the peoples, O God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Then my enemies will turn back when I call.
This I know because God is for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God, whose word I praise,
Yahweh, whose word I praise,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God I trust; I do not fear.
What can mere humankind do to me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My vows to you, O God, are binding upon me.
I will pay thank offerings to you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because you have delivered my soul from death.
Have you not kept my feet from stumbling,
that I may walk before God
in the light of the living?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be gracious to me, O God, be gracious to me,
because in you my soul takes refuge.
In the shadow of your wings I will take refuge
until destruction passes by.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will call to God Most High,
to God who accomplishes things concerning me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
My soul is among lions.
I lie down among those who devour—
the children of humankind whose teeth are spears and arrows
and whose tongues are sharp swords.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be exalted above the heavens, O God.
Let your glory be above all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I will give you thanks among the peoples, O Lord;
I will give you praise among the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because your loyal love is high to the heavens,
and your faithfulness to the clouds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be exalted above the heavens, O God.
Let your glory be above all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do you really speak what is right when silent?
Do you judge fairly the children of humankind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No, in your heart you plan injustices;
in the land you weigh out the violence of your hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked are estranged from the womb.
They go astray from the belly, speaking lies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their venom is like snake venom;
They are like a deaf viper that closes its ear
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so that it does not hear the voice of charmers
or the skilled caster of spells.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O God, break their teeth in their mouth.
Break off the fangs of the young lions, O Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them run away like water that runs off.
When he bends the bow, let his arrows be as though they were cut off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them be like a snail that melts away as it goes;
like the stillborn of woman that do not see the sun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Before your pots can feel the heat of a thornbush,
whether green or dry, he will sweep it away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous will rejoice when he sees the vengeance;
he will wash his feet in the blood of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And people will say, “Surely there is a reward for the righteous.
Surely there is a God who judges in the land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver me from my enemies, O my God.
Protect me from those who rise up against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver me from workers of iniquity,
and from men of bloodshed save me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For look, they lie in wait for my life.
The mighty attack against me,
not because of my transgression or my sin, O Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Without guilt on my part they run and ready themselves.
Awake to meet me and see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And you, Yahweh, God of hosts, are the God of Israel.
Rouse yourself to punish all the nations.
Do not be gracious to any who treacherously plot evil. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They return at evening; they howl like dogs
while they prowl the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, they pour out talk with their mouth.
Swords are on their lips,
for they say, “Who hears?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you, O Yahweh, will laugh at them;
you will mock all the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O my strength, I will watch for you,
because you, O God, are my (high) stronghold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My God of loyal love will meet me;
God will cause me to look in triumph on my enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not kill them, lest my people forget.
Make them to wander by your power,
and bring them down, O Lord, our shield.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By the sin of their mouth and the words of their lips,
even in their pride, let them be trapped,
and for the curses and lies they proclaim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Destroy in anger; destroy so they are no more,
so that they may know that God is ruling in Jacob
to the ends of the earth. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They return at evening; they howl like dogs
while they prowl the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for them, they wander for food.
If they are not satisfied, then they continue all night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But as for me, I will sing of your strength,
and I will hail your loyal love in the morning,
because you have been my high stronghold
and a refuge in my time of trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O my strength, to you I will give praise,
because God is my high stronghold,
my God of loyal love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O God, you have rejected us. You have broken us.
You have been angry. Restore us!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have made the land quake. You have split it open.
Heal its fissures, because it totters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have shown your people hard things;
You have given us wine that staggers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have rallied those who fear you round a banner
out of bowshot, Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so that your beloved ones may be rescued.
Save by your right hand and answer us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God has spoken in his holiness,
“I will rejoice;
I will divide up Shechem,
and portion out the valley of Succoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Who will bring me to the fortified city?
Who will lead me to Edom?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have not you yourself rejected us, O God,
and not gone out with our armies, O God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give us help against the adversary,
for the help of humankind is futile.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Through God we will do valiantly,
and it is he who will tread down our enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear, O God, my cry;
attend to my prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the end of the earth I call to you
when my heart grows faint.
You will lead me to a rock that is higher than I.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you have been my refuge,
a strong tower from the enemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let me reside in your tent forever.
Let me take refuge under the covering of your wings. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you, O God, you have heard my vows.
You have given me the heritage of those who fear your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will add days to the days of the king,
his years like those of many generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May he live forever in the presence of God.
Appoint loyal love and faithfulness to preserve him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So I will sing the praise of your name forever,
that I may fulfill my vows daily.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Only for God my soul waits in silence.
From him is my salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Only he is my rock and my salvation,
my high stronghold; I shall not be greatly shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long will you attack a man?
All of you will be shattered
like a leaning wall, a tottering fence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They only plan to thrust him down from his high position;
they are pleased with deception.
With their mouths they bless,
but inwardly they curse. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Only for God wait in silence, O my soul,
because my hope is from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Only he is my rock and my salvation,
my high stronghold; I shall not be shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On God rests my salvation and my glory;
God is my strong rock, my refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Only a vapor are men of low degree,
a deception are men of high degree.
Weighed in a balance,
together they are lighter than a vapor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not trust in extortion,
and do not put vain confidence in robbery.
If wealth increases,
do not set your heart on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And to you belongs loyal love, O Lord,
because you will render to each according to his work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O God, you are my God;
I will seek you diligently.
My soul thirsts for you; my flesh longs for you
as in a dry and weary land without water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus I have seen you in the sanctuary,
beholding your strength and glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because your loyal love is better than life,
my lips will praise you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So I will bless you while I live.
I will lift up my hands in your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul will be satisfied as with the best and richest food,
and with joyful lips my mouth will praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I remember you on my bed,
I meditate on you in the night watches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because you have been my help,
therefore in the shadow of your wings I will sing for joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul clings to you;
your right hand upholds me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But as for them who seek my life for ruin,
they will go into the depths of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They who would deliver him to the sword
will become a portion for jackals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
However, the king will rejoice in God.
Everyone who swears an oath by him will boast,
because the mouth of the liars will be stopped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear my voice, O God, in my lamenting.
Preserve my life from the fear of the enemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hide me from the secret plots of evildoers,
from the unrest of those who do iniquity,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who sharpen their tongue like a sword.
They bend their bow to shoot their arrows—bitter words,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to shoot from their hiding places at the blameless.
Suddenly they shoot at him and do not fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They encourage themselves in the evil matter.
They talk of secretly laying snares.
They say, “Who will see them?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They carefully plot injustices saying,
“We have perfected the perfect plot!”
Both the inner thought and heart of a man are deep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But God will shoot them;
with an arrow they will suddenly be wounded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they who would cause him to stumble,
their own tongue will be against them.
All who gaze on them will shake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And then all men will fear,
and will declare the working of God,
and will understand his doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous will rejoice in Yahweh and take refuge in him,
and all the upright in heart will boast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise awaits you, O God, in Zion,
and to you the vow shall be fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O you who hear prayer,
to you all flesh will come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Iniquities prevail over me.
As for our transgressions, you will forgive them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed is one whom you choose and bring near,
that he may abide in your courts.
We will be satisfied with the goodness of your house,
your holy temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By awesome deeds in righteousness you will answer us,
O God of our salvation,
you who are the confidence of all the ends of the earth
and of the far-off seas,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who established the mountains by his strength,
the one who is girded with might,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who stills the roar of the seas,
the roar of their waves,
and the commotion of the peoples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so that the inhabitants of the farthest reaches are in awe of your signs.
You make the dawn and sunset sing for joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You care for the land and water it;
you greatly enrich it.
The stream of God is filled with waters.
You provide their grain,
for so you have established it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You drench its furrows,
penetrating its ridges.
With rains you soften it;
its growth you bless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You crown the year with your bounty,
and your wagon paths drip with richness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They drop on the pastures of the wilderness,
and the hills gird themselves with joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The pasturelands put on flocks,
and the valleys clothe themselves with grain.
They shout in triumph;
they even sing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shout joyfully to God, all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing the glory of his name.
Set forth his glorious praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Say to God, “How awesome are your works!
Because of the greatness of your strength,
your enemies will cringe before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the earth will bow in worship to you,
and sing praise to you.
They will sing the praise of your name.” Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Come and consider the works of God;
he is awesome in his dealings with the children of humankind.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Bless our God, O peoples,
and cause the sound of his praise to be heard,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the one who has kept our soul among the living,
and has not allowed our foot to slip.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you have tested us, O God;
you have tried us as silver is tried.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You brought us into the net;
you placed a heavy burden on our backs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You let men ride over our heads.
We went through fire and through water,
but you have brought us out to the place of abundance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will come into your house with burnt offerings.
I will pay to you my vows
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that my lips uttered,
and my mouth spoke in my distress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Burnt offerings of fat animals I will offer to you,
with the smoke of rams.
I will do cattle with rams. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Come and hear, all you God-fearers, and I will tell
what he has done for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I called to him with my mouth,
and he was extolled with my tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I had considered evil in my heart,
the Lord would not have listened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
However, God has listened;
he has attended to the sound of my prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be God,
who has not turned aside my prayer,
or his loyal love from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May God be gracious to us and bless us.
May he cause his face to shine toward us, Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that your way may be known on the earth,
your salvation among all nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the peoples praise you, O God;
let all of the peoples praise you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the nations be glad and sing for joy,
because you judge the peoples with equity
and guide the nations on the earth. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the peoples praise you, O God;
let all the peoples praise you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The earth has yielded its produce.
God, our God, will bless us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God will bless us,
and all the ends of the earth will fear him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God will arise; his enemies will be scattered,
and those who hate him will flee from before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As smoke is driven off, you will drive them off.
As wax melts before fire,
the wicked will perish before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the righteous will be glad; they will exalt before God,
and will rejoice with joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to God, sing praises to his name.
Lift up a song to the rider on the clouds—his name is Yah—
and rejoice before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A father to orphans and a judge for widows
is God in his holy habitation.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
O God, when you went out before your people,
when you marched through the desert, Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the earth shook; the heavens also dripped rain
at the presence of God who was at Sinai,
at the presence of God, the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You caused abundant rain to fall, O God.
When your inheritance was weary you revived it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your community dwelled in it.
You provided in your goodness for the poor, O God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord gives the word.
Great is the company of women who announce:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The kings of armies flee, they flee,
and she who remains at home divides the spoil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though you men lie down between the sheepfolds,
you will be like the wings of a dove covered in silver
and its pinions in yellow gold.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When Shaddai scattered kings on it,
on Zalmon it snowed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A mountain of God is the mountain of Bashan;
a mountain of many peaks is the mountain of Bashan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do you look with hostility, O many-peaked mountains?
This mountain God desires for his dwelling.
Yes, Yahweh will abide in it forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The chariots of God
are twice ten thousand, with thousands doubled.
The Lord is among them at Sinai, distinctive in victory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have ascended on high; you have led away captives.
You have received gifts from among humankind,
and even from the rebellious, so that Yah God may dwell there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be the Lord. Daily he loads us with benefits,
the God of our salvation. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our God is a God of deliverances,
and to the Yahweh the Lord belong escapes from death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But God will shatter the head of his enemies,
the hairy scalp of the one who continues on in his guilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord said, “I will bring them back from Bashan;
I will bring them back from the depths of the sea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so that your foot may shatter them bloody
for the tongues of your dogs to have their share from the enemies.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have seen your processions, O God,
the processions of my God, my king, distinctive in victory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Singers went up front, those playing stringed instruments last,
between them young women playing tambourines.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bless God in the assemblies,
Yahweh from the fountain of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is little Benjamin ruling them,
with the princes of Judah in their throng,
the princes of Zebulun and the princes of Naphtali.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your God has commanded your strength.
Show yourself strong, O God, by what you perform for us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because your temple is above Jerusalem,
kings will bring tribute to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rebuke the beasts in the reeds,
the herd of bulls with the calves of the peoples,
trampling the pieces of silver.
Scatter the nations who delight in battles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ambassadors will come from Egypt;
Cush will quickly stretch out her hands to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O kingdoms of the earth, sing to God;
sing praise to the Lord, Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to the one who rides in the highest heavens of old.
See, he gives forth his voice, a mighty voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ascribe strength to God.
His majesty is over Israel,
and his strength is in the clouds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Awesome are you, O God, from your sanctuary.
The God of Israel, it is he who gives strength and might to the people.
Blessed be God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Save me, O God,
because waters have come up to my neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I sink in the mud of the deep, and there is no foothold.
I have come to watery depths,
and the torrent floods over me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am weary with my calling out; my throat is parched.
My eyes are exhausted in my waiting for my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
More numerous than the hairs of my head
are those hating me without a cause.
Those who are destroying me—my enemies wrongfully— are mighty.
What I did not steal, I then must restore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O God, you yourself know my foolishness,
and my guilty deeds are not hidden from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let those who wait for you not be put to shame because of me,
O Lord Yahweh of hosts.
Let those who seek you not be disgraced because of me,
O God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because on account of you I have borne reproach;
disgrace has covered my face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have become a stranger to my brothers
and a foreigner to my mother’s sons,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because the zeal for your house has consumed me,
and the reproaches of those reproaching you have fallen on me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I wept in the fasting of my soul,
it became reproaches for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I made sackcloth my clothing,
I became for them a byword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those sitting at the gate talk about me
as also the songs of the drunkards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But as for me, my prayer is to you, O Yahweh, for a favorable time,
O God, according to the abundance of your loyal love.
Answer me with the faithfulness of your salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver me from the mud and do not let me sink.
Let me be delivered from those who hate me
and from the watery depths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not let the torrent of waters flood over me,
or the deep swallow me,
or the pit close its mouth over me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Answer me, O Yahweh, because your loyal love is good;
according to your abundant mercies, turn to me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and do not hide your face from your servant.
Because I am in trouble, answer me quickly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Draw near to my soul; redeem it.
Because of my enemies, ransom me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You know my reproach, my shame and my disgrace.
Fully known to you are all my adversaries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Reproach has broken my heart and I am sick.
And I hoped for sympathy, but there was none,
and for comforters, but I found none.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They also gave me gall for food,
and for my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let their table before them be a trap,
and their times of peace a snare.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let their eyes be dark so they cannot see,
and make their loins continually tremble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pour out your indignation on them,
and let your burning anger overtake them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let their camp be desolate.
Let none dwell in their tents,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because they persecute those whom you, yourself, have struck,
and they tell of the pain of those you have wounded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Add guilt on top of their guilt,
and do not let them be acquitted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them be blotted out of the book of the living,
and let them not be recorded with the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But as for me, though I am afflicted and pained,
your salvation will protect me, O God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will praise the name of God in song,
and magnify him with thanksgiving.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For Yahweh it will be better than an ox or bull,
horned and hoofed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The afflicted will see and rejoice.
O God seekers, let your heart revive,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because Yahweh hears the needy
and does not despise his own who are prisoners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let heavens and earth praise him,
the seas and all that moves in them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because God will save Zion
and build the cities of Judah,
that they may dwell there and possess it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the offspring of his servants will inherit it,
and those who love his name will abide in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O God, make haste to deliver me.
O Yahweh, make haste to help me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them be ashamed and abashed
who seek my life.
Let them be repulsed and humiliated
who desire my harm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
let them turn back because of their shame,
those who say, “Aha! Aha!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them rejoice and be glad in you,
all those who seek you.
Let them say continually, “God is great!”
those who love your salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I am poor and needy;
O God hasten to me.
You are my help and my deliverer.
O Yahweh, do not delay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In you, O Yahweh, I have taken refuge;
let me never be put to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In your righteousness deliver me and rescue me;
incline your ear to me and save me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
My God, rescue me from the hand of the wicked,
from the grasp of the evildoer and the oppressor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because you are my hope,
O Lord Yahweh, my confidence from my youth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Upon you I have leaned from birth.
It was you who took me from the womb of my mother.
My praise is of you continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have become a wonder to many,
but you are my strong refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My mouth is filled with your praise,
with your glory all the day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not cast me away in the time of old age;
when my strength fails do not abandon me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For my enemies talk concerning me,
and those who watch for my life conspire together,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
saying, “His God has abandoned him.
Pursue and seize him, because there is no deliverer.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O God, do not be far from me.
My God, hurry to help me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them be ashamed; let them perish
who are my adversaries.
Let them wrap themselves with scorn and disgrace
who seek my harm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But as for me, I will hope continually
and increase your praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My mouth will tell of your righteousness,
your salvation all day long,
though I do not know the full sum of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will come in to tell the mighty deeds of Lord Yahweh.
I will make known your righteousness, yours only.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O God, you have taught me from my youth,
and up to now I have proclaimed your wonderful deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And even when I am old and gray,
O God, do not abandon me
until I proclaim your strength to this generation,
your power to every one that comes after.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And your righteousness, O God, is to the height of heaven.
You who have done great things,
O God, who is like you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You who have caused me to see many troubles and evils,
you will again revive me.
And from the depths of the earth
you will again bring me up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will increase my greatness,
and you will comfort me all around.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On my part, I will praise you with a stringed instrument,
and your faithfulness, O my God.
I will sing praises to you with a lyre,
O Holy One of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My lips will sing for joy when I sing praises to you,
and my soul, which you have redeemed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My tongue also
will speak of your righteousness all the day,
because they have been put to shame, because they have been humiliated
who seek my harm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O God, give your judgments to the king,
and your righteousness to the king’s son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May he judge your people with righteousness,
and your poor with justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the mountains yield prosperity for the people,
and the hills in righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May he provide justice for the poor of the people,
save the children of the needy,
and crush the oppressor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May he live long while the sun endures
as long as the moon for all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May he descend like rain on mown grass,
like showers watering the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May what is right blossom in his days
and an abundance of peace, until the moon is no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And may he rule from sea up to sea,
and from the River to the edges of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the desert dwellers bow down before him,
and his enemies lick the dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the kings of Tarshish and the islands bring tribute.
Let the kings of Sheba and Seba present gifts,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and let all kings bow down to him.
Let all nations serve him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed he will deliver the needy who is crying for help,
and the afflicted who has no helper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will take pity on the helpless and needy,
and the lives of the needy he will save.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From oppression and from violence
he will redeem their lives,
and their blood will be precious in his eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So may he live, and may gold from Sheba be given to him,
and may prayers be offered for him continually.
May blessings be invoked for him all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May there be an abundance of grain in the land
even on the top of the mountains.
May his crop sway like the trees of Lebanon,
and may those from the city blossom like the grass of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May his name endure forever.
May his name increase as long as the sun shines,
and let them be blessed in him.
Let all nations call him blessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be Yahweh God, the God of Israel,
who alone does wonderful things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And blessed be his glorious name forever,
and may the whole earth be filled with his glory.
Amen and Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The prayers of David, the son of Jesse, are completed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely God is good to Israel,
to those pure of heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But as for me, my feet had almost stumbled.
My steps had nearly slipped,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because I envied the boastful
when I saw the well-being of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For there are no pains up to their death,
and their bodies are healthy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They do not have ordinary trouble,
and they are not plagued as other people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore pride is their necklace;
an outfit of violence covers them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their eye bulges from fat.
Imaginings overflow their heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They mock and speak maliciously of oppression;
they speak as though from on high.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They set their mouth against the heavens,
and their tongue roams the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore his people turn there,
and abundant waters are slurped up by them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they say, “How does God know?”
and, “Does the Most High have knowledge?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
See, these are the wicked,
and they increase wealth, ever carefree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely in vain I have kept my heart pure,
and washed my hands in innocence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I have been plagued all day
and rebuked every morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I had said, “I will speak thus,”
behold, I would have acted treacherously
against your children’s generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I thought about how to understand this,
it was troubling in my eyes
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
until I went into the sanctuary of God.
Then I understood their fate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely you set them on slippery places.
You cause them to fall onto ruin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How they become a desolation in a moment!
They come to a complete end by terrors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like a dream upon awakening,
when you wake up, O Lord,
you will despise their fleeting form.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When my heart was embittered
and I felt stabbed in my kidneys,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
then I was brutish and ignorant.
With you I was like the beasts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I am continually with you;
you have hold of my right hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will guide me with your advice,
and afterward you will take me into honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whom do I have in the heavens except you?
And with you I have no other desire on earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My flesh and heart failed,
but God is the strength of my heart and my reward forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For indeed, those distancing themselves from you will be ruined.
You destroy each who abandons you for harlotry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But as for me, the approach to God is for my good.
I have set the Lord Yahweh as my refuge,
in order to tell all your works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why, O God, have you rejected us forever?
Why does your anger smoke
against the sheep of your pasture?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember your congregation that you bought long ago,
when you redeemed the tribe of your inheritance.
Remember Mount Zion where you have dwelt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lift your steps to the perpetual ruins,
to all that the enemy has ruined in the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your enemies have roared in the midst of your meeting place;
they have set up their signs for signs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are known to be like those who wield
axes in a thicket of trees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And now its carved works altogether
they have smashed with axe and hammer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have set fire to your sanctuary.
They have defiled to the ground,
the dwelling place for your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have said in their heart,
“We will completely oppress them.”
They burned all the meeting places of God in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We do not see our signs,
and there is no longer a prophet.
No one with us knows how long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long, O God, will the adversary taunt?
Will the enemy treat your name with contempt forever?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do you draw back your hand, even your right hand?
Take it from your bosom; destroy them!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But God has been my king from long ago,
working salvation in the midst of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You split open the sea by your strength;
You broke the heads of the sea monsters in the waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You crushed the heads of Leviathan;
you gave him as food to the desert dwelling creatures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You split open spring and wadi.
You dried up ever-flowing rivers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yours is the day, yours is the night also.
You established light and the sun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You defined all the boundaries of the earth;
Summer and winter—you formed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Yahweh, remember this: the enemy taunts,
and foolish people treat your name with contempt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not give to beasts the life of your dove;
do not ever forget the life of your afflicted ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have regard for the covenant,
because the dark places of the land are full of
the haunts of violence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not let the oppressed turn back humiliated;
let the poor and needy praise your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rise up, O God, plead your cause;
remember the reproaching of you by the foolish all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not forget the sound of your adversaries,
the roar of those rising up against you ascending continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“I will indeed set an appointed time;
I will judge fairly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The earth and all its inhabitants are shaking;
I steady its columns. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I say to the boastful, ‘Do not boast!’
and to the wicked, ‘Do not lift up your horn!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not lift up high your horn.
Do not speak with arrogant pride.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For it is not from the east or the west
and not from the south that lifting up comes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
rather God is the judge;
one he brings low, and another he lifts up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For there is a cup in the hand of Yahweh
with wine that foams, fully mixed,
and he pours out from this.
Surely all the wicked of the land
will quaff it down to its dregs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But as for me, I will proclaim forever;
I will sing praise to the God of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“And all the horns of the wicked I will cut off.
The horns of the righteous will be lifted up.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God is known in Judah.
His name is great in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His den has been in Salem,
his lair in Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There he broke the flames of the bow,
the shield and sword and battle. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Radiant you are, majestic,
from the mountains of prey.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
At your rebuke, O God of Jacob,
both rider and horse slumber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You, indeed, are to be feared,
and who can stand before you
when you are angry?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From heaven you proclaimed judgment.
The earth feared and was still
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when God rose for justice,
to save all the afflicted of the land. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the anger of humankind will praise you.
You will put on the remnant of anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He cuts off the spirit of leaders.
He is to be feared by the kings of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I cry out with my voice to God;
with my voice to God, that he may hear me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I remember God and I groan loudly;
I meditate and my spirit grows faint.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You hold open my eyelids.
I am troubled and cannot speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I think about the days from long ago,
the years of ancient times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I remember my song in the night.
With my heart I meditate,
and my spirit searches to understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will the Lord reject us forever,
and will he never be pleased with us again?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Has his loyal love ceased forever?
Is his promise ended throughout generations?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Has God forgotten to have compassion?
Or has he closed off his mercies in anger? Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So I said, “This pierces me—
the right hand of the Most High has changed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will remember the deeds of Yah.
Surely I will remember your wonders from long ago.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will also muse on all your work,
and meditate on your deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O God, your way is distinctive.
Who is a great god like our God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are the God who works wonders;
you have made known your might among the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With your arm you redeemed your people,
the children of Jacob and Joseph. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The clouds poured out water.
The skies thundered.
Your arrows also flew about.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Your way was through the sea,
and your path through many waters.
Yet your footprints were not discerned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You led your people like a flock
by the hand of Moses and Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen, O my people, to my teaching.
Incline your ears to the words of my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will offer a parable with my mouth.
I will pour out riddles from long ago,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that we have heard and known,
and our ancestors have told us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We will not hide them from their children,
telling the next generation the praises of Yahweh,
and his power and his wonders that he has done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he established a testimony in Jacob,
and appointed a law in Israel,
which he commanded our ancestors
to teach to their children,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so that the next generation might know—
children yet to be born—
that they might rise up and tell their children,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that they might set their confidence in God,
and not forget the deeds of God,
but keep his commandments,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and not be like their ancestors,
a stubborn and rebellious generation,
a generation that did not make ready its heart,
whose spirit was not faithful to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Ephraim, armed with archers,
turned back on the day of battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They did not keep the covenant of God
and refused to go in his law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They also forgot his deeds,
and his wonders that he had shown them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In front of their ancestors he did a wonder,
in the land of Egypt, in the region of Zoan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He split the sea and caused them to go over,
and he caused waters to stand like a heap.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he led them with the cloud by day,
and all night with a fiery light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He caused rocks to split in the wilderness
and provided drink abundantly as from the depths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he brought streams out of the rock
and caused water to flow down like rivers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But they sinned still further against him
by rebelling against the Most High in the desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they tested God in their heart
by asking food for their craving.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they spoke against God.
They said, “Is God able
to prepare a table in the wilderness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, he struck the rock and water flowed
and streams gushed out,
but can he also give food
or provide meat for his people?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore Yahweh heard
and he was very angry,
and a fire was kindled against Jacob,
and his anger also rose up against Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because they did not believe God,
and they did not trust his salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Nevertheless, he commanded the skies above
and opened the doors of heaven,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and rained down on them manna to eat
and gave them the grain of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Humankind ate the bread of angels.
He sent them food enough to be satisfied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He caused the east wind to blow in the heavens
and drove along the south wind by his strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he rained meat on them like dust,
even winged birds like the sand of the seas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He caused them to fall in the midst of his camp,
all around his dwellings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So they ate and were well filled,
and he brought about what they craved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They had not yet turned aside from their craving,
while their food was still in their mouth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the anger of God rose against them,
and he killed some of the stoutest of them,
even the young men of Israel he caused to bow down in death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In spite of all this they sinned further
and did not believe his wonders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he consumed their days with futility 
their years with terror.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When he killed some of them, then they sought him,
and repented and earnestly sought God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they remembered that God was their rock,
and God Most High their redeemer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But they enticed him with their mouth
and lied to him with their tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For their heart was not steadfast with him,
nor were they faithful to his covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But he was compassionate; he pardoned their guilt
and did not destroy them.
And many times he turned back his anger
and did not stir up all his wrath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for he remembered that they were flesh,
a passing wind that does not return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How often they rebelled against him in the wilderness
and vexed him in the wasteland!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So they again tested God
and distressed the Holy One of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they did not remember his power
when he redeemed them from the enemy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
how he performed his signs in Egypt
and his wonders in the region of Zoan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when he turned their rivers to blood
so they could not drink from their streams.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sent among them flies that devoured them
and frogs that destroyed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he gave their crop to the locusts
and their labor to the locust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He destroyed their vines with hail
and their sycamore trees with sleet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He also handed their cattle over to the hail
and their livestock to the lightning bolts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sent against them his fierce anger,
rage and indignation and trouble,
a band of destroying angels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He cleared a path for his anger.
He did not spare them from death
but handed their life over to the plague.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he struck down all the firstborn in Egypt,
the first of their virility in the tents of Ham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he led out his people like sheep
and guided them like a herd in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he led them safely and they were not afraid,
but the sea covered their enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So he brought them to his holy territory,
this mountain his right hand acquired.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he drove out nations before them
and allocated them for an inheritance by boundary line,
and settled the tribes of Israel in their tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But they tested and rebelled against God Most High
and did not keep his statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they turned and were treacherous like their ancestors.
They twisted like a crooked bow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they provoked him to anger with their high places,
and made him jealous with their images.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God heard and he was very angry
and rejected Israel utterly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So he abandoned the dwelling place at Shiloh,
the tent he had placed among humankind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he gave his strength into captivity
and his splendor into the hand of the enemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He also handed his people over to the sword,
and he was very angry with his inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fire devoured his young men,
and his young women were not praised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His priests fell by the sword,
and his widows did not weep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the Lord awoke like one who had been asleep,
awoke like a warrior who had been drunk with wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he beat back his enemies;
he gave them over to perpetual scorn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he rejected the tent of Joseph,
and did not chose the tribe of Ephraim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but chose the tribe of Judah,
Mount Zion that he loved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he built his sanctuary like the heights,
like the earth that he established forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he chose David his servant
and took him from the sheepfolds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He brought him from following nursing ewes
to shepherd Jacob, his people,
and Israel, his inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he shepherded them according to the integrity of his heart,
and led them by the skillfulness of his hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They have given the bodies of your servants
as food for the birds of the heavens,
the flesh of your faithful to the beasts of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have poured out their blood like water
all around Jerusalem,
and there was none to bury them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We have become a taunt to our neighbors,
a derision and a scorn to those around us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long, O Yahweh? Will you be angry forever?
Will your jealousy burn like fire?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pour out your anger on the nations
that do not know you,
and on the kingdoms
that do not call on your name,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because they have devoured Jacob
and have laid waste his habitation.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Help us, O God of our salvation,
for the glory of your name;
and deliver us and forgive our sins
for the sake of your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why should the nations say,
“Where is their God?”
Let it be known among the nations before our eyes,
by the avenging of the blood of your servants
that was poured out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the groaning of the prisoner come before you.
According to the greatness of your power,
spare the children appointed to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And return to our neighbors sevenfold upon them
their taunts with which they taunted you, O Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then we, your people and the flock of your pasture,
we will give thanks to you forever.
Generation after generation
we will tell of your praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give ear, O shepherd of Israel,
who leads Joseph like a flock.
Shine forth, you who sits enthroned above the cherubim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Before Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh,
stir up your power
and come for our salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O God, restore us,
and cause your face to shine that we may be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Yahweh God of hosts,
how long will you be angry
against the prayer of your people?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have fed them the bread of tears;
you have given them tears to drink in full measure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have made us an object of strife to our neighbors,
and our enemies mock among themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O God of hosts, restore us
and cause your face to shine that we may be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You uprooted a vine from Egypt;
you drove out the nations and planted it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You prepared a place before it,
and it took deep root and filled the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mountains were covered with its shade,
and the mighty cedars with its boughs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It spread its branches to the sea
and its shoots to the river.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why have you broken down its walls,
so that all who pass on the road pluck fruit from it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Swine from the forests devour it
and creatures of the field feed on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Please return, O God of hosts.
Observe from heaven and see,
and pay attention to this vine,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
eventhe stalk that your right hand planted,
and concerning the shoot you strengthened for yourself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is burned with fire, cut down.
They perish at the rebuke of your face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let your hand be on the man of your right hand,
on the son of humankind whom you made strong for yourself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then we will not turn back from you.
Restore us to life, and we will proclaim your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Yahweh God of hosts, restore us;
cause your face to shine that we may be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shout out to God our strength;
shout joyfully to the God of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lift up a song and strike the tambourine,
the pleasant lyre, together with the harp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blow the horn at new moon,
at full moon, for our feast day,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because it is a statute for Israel,
an ordinance of the God of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He made it a statute in Joseph
when he went out against the land of Egypt,
where I heard a language I did not know.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I removed his shoulder from a burden.
His hands were freed from the basket.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Hear, O my people, and I will admonish you;
O Israel, if you would but listen to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There shall be no strange god among you,
and you shall not bow down to a foreign god.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am Yahweh your God,
who brought you up from the land of Egypt.
Open wide your mouth and I will fill it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But my people did not listen to my voice,
and Israel did not yield to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So I let them go in the stubbornness of their heart;
they walked in their counsels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh that my people would listen to me;
that Israel would walk in my ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I would subdue their enemies quickly,
and turn my hand against their adversaries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who hate Yahweh would cringe before him,
and their fate would be forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But he would feed him from the choicest wheat,
and I would satisfy you with honey from a rock.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God stands in the divine assembly;
he administers judgment in the midst of the gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“How long will you judge unjustly
and show favoritism to the wicked? Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Judge on behalf of the helpless and the orphan;
provide justice to the afflicted and the poor.
