You rebuke the arrogant, the accursed,
who stray from your commands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remove from me scorn and contempt,
for I have kept your testimonies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even though princes sit and speak against me,
your servant meditates on your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your testimonies are my delight,
my counselors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul clings to the dust;
revive me according to your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I told of my ways, and you answered me;
teach me your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make me understand the way of your precepts,
that I may meditate on your wonderful things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul weeps because of grief;
strengthen me according to your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remove from me the deceptive way,
and graciously give me your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have chosen the faithful way;
I have set your ordinances before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I cling to your testimonies;
O Yahweh, do not let me be put to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will run the way of your commands,
for you will enlarge my heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Teach me, O Yahweh, the way of your statutes,
and I will keep it to the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give me understanding, that I may keep your law
and heed it with my whole heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cause me to walk in the path of your commands,
for I delight in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Incline my heart to your testimonies,
and not to dishonest gain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Turn away my eyes from looking at what is worthless;
revive me in your ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fulfill your word to your servant,
which is to bring about a reverence for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Turn away my disgrace that I dread,
for your ordinances are good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, I have longed for your precepts;
revive me in your righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let your acts of loyal love also come to me, O Yahweh,
your salvation according to your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I will have an answer for the one who taunts me,
for I trust your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And do not snatch the word of truth utterly from my mouth,
for I hope in your ordinances.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So I will heed your law continually,
forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I will go about freely,
for I have sought your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I will speak of your testimonies before kings,
and will not be ashamed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I will take delight in your commands,
which I love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I will lift up my hands to your commands, which I love,
and I will meditate on your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember your word to your servant,
upon which you have caused me to hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is my comfort in my misery:
that your word preserves my life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The arrogant utterly deride me;
I have not turned aside from your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I remember your ordinances of old, O Yahweh,
and I take comfort.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rage seizes me because of the wicked,
those who forsake your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your statutes have been my songs
in the house of my sojourning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I remember your name in the night, O Yahweh,
and I heed your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This has been mine,
that I have kept your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh is my portion;
I intend to heed your words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I seek your favor with my whole heart;
be gracious to me according to your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I think about my ways,
and turn my feet to your testimonies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I hurry and do not delay
to heed your commands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The cords of the wicked surround me,
but I do not forget your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the middle of the night I rise to give you thanks,
because of your righteous ordinances.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am a companion of all who fear you
and heed your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The earth, O Yahweh, is full of your loyal love.
Teach me your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have dealt well with your servant,
O Yahweh, according to your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Teach me good discernment and knowledge,
for I believe your commands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Before I was afflicted, I was going astray,
but now I heed your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are good and do good;
teach me your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The arrogant smear me with lies;
I keep your precepts with my whole heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their heart is insensitive like fat;
As for me, I take delight in your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is good for me that I was afflicted,
so that I might learn your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The law of your mouth is better to me
than thousands of gold and silver coins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your hands have made me and established me;
give me understanding that I may learn your commands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who fear you will see me and be glad,
because I hope in your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I know, O Yahweh, that your judgments are right,
and that in faithfulness you afflicted me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Please let your loyal love comfort me,
according to your word to your servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let your mercies come to me, that I may live,
for your law is my delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the arrogant be put to shame,
because they have wronged me with lies.
As for me, I will meditate on your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let those who fear you turn to me,
even those who know your testimonies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May my heart be blameless in your statutes,
so that I may not be ashamed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul languishes for your salvation;
I hope in your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My eyes long for your word,
saying, “When will you comfort me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I have become like a wineskin in the smoke,
yet I have not forgotten your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How many are the days of your servant?
When will you execute justice against those who persecute me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The arrogant have dug pits for me,
which is not according to your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All your commands are faithful.
They persecute me deceitfully; help me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have almost destroyed me on the earth,
but I have not forsaken your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
According to your loyal love preserve me alive,
so that I may heed the testimony from your mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Forever, O Yahweh,
your word is settled in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your faithfulness endures throughout all generations.
You have established the earth and it stands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By your ordinances they stand today,
for all are your servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Unless your law had been my delight,
then I would have perished in my misery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will not ever forget your precepts,
for by them you revive me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am yours. Save me,
for I have sought your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For me the wicked lie in wait to destroy me.
I give attention to your testimonies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have seen a limit to every perfection;
your command is very broad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How I love your law!
The whole day it is my meditation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your commands make me wiser than my enemies,
because they are ever with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have more insight than all my teachers,
for your testimonies are my meditation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I understand more than the elders,
for I keep your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have restrained my feet from every evil way,
so that I may heed your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have not turned aside from your ordinances,
for you have taught me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How smooth are your words to my palate,
more than honey in my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From your precepts I get understanding,
therefore I hate every false way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your word is a lamp to my feet
and a light to my path.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have sworn an oath and confirmed it,
to heed your righteous ordinances.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am very much afflicted;
O Yahweh, revive me according to your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Please accept the freewill offerings of my mouth, O Yahweh,
and teach me your ordinances.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My life is in danger continually,
yet I do not forget your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked have laid a snare for me,
yet I do not wander from your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have taken as my own your testimonies forever,
for they are the joy of my heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have inclined my heart to do your statutes
forever, to the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I hate the double-minded,
but I love your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are my hiding place and my shield;
I hope in your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Turn aside from me, you evildoers,
for I will keep the commands of my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sustain me according to your word, that I may live,
and do not let me be ashamed of my hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Uphold me, that I may be delivered,
and have regard for your statutes continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You reject all who stray from your statutes,
for their deceit is a breach of faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You remove all the wicked of the earth like dross,
therefore I love your testimonies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My flesh trembles for fear of you,
and I am afraid of your judgments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have done justice and righteousness;
do not leave me to my oppressors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pledge good for your servant;
do not let the arrogant oppress me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My eyes long for your salvation,
and your righteous word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deal with your servant according to your loyal love,
and teach me your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am your servant; give me understanding,
that I may know your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is time for Yahweh to act,
for they have broken your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore I love your commands
more than gold, even fine gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore all your precepts of everything I regard as right;
I hate every false way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your testimonies are miracles,
therefore my soul keeps them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The unfolding of your words gives light,
giving understanding to the simple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I open my mouth and pant,
because I long for your commands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Turn to me and be gracious to me,
as is proper for those who love your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Direct my steps in your word,
and do not let any iniquity gain power over me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Redeem me from the oppression of humankind,
that I may heed your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shine your face on your servant,
and teach me your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Streams of water flow down from my eyes,
because people do not heed your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are righteous, O Yahweh,
and your ordinances are upright.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have ordained your testimonies in righteousness,
and in exceeding faithfulness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My zeal consumes me,
because my enemies have forgotten your words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your word is very pure,
and your servant loves it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am small and despised,
yet I do not forget your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your righteousness is an everlasting righteousness,
and your law is truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Trouble and anguish have found me;
your commands delight me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteousness of your testimonies is forever;
give me understanding that I may live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I call with my whole heart; answer me, O Yahweh.
I will keep your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I call to you. Save me,
and I will heed your testimonies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I rise early in the dawn and cry for help;
I hope in your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My eyes anticipate the night watches,
that I may meditate on your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear my voice according to your loyal love;
O Yahweh, preserve my life according to your justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who pursue a wicked purpose draw near;
they are far from your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are near, O Yahweh,
and all your commands are truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Concerning your testimonies, I knew long ago
that you have established them forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
See my misery and rescue me,
for I do not forget your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Plead my cause and redeem me;
preserve my life according to your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Salvation is far from the wicked,
for they do not seek your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your mercies are great, O Yahweh;
preserve my life according to your ordinances.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My persecutors and enemies are many,
yet I do not turn aside from your testimonies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I see the treacherous and I feel disgust,
because they do not heed your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Consider that I love your precepts;
O Yahweh, according to your loyal love preserve my life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The whole of your word is truth,
and your every righteous judgment endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Princes persecute me without cause,
but my heart trembles because of your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am rejoicing over your word,
like one who finds great spoil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I hate and abhor falsehood;
I love your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I praise you seven times in the day
for your righteous ordinances.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Great peace is for those who love your law,
and they do not have a cause for stumbling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I hope for your salvation, O Yahweh,
and do your commands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul heeds your testimonies,
and I love them exceedingly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I heed your precepts and testimonies,
because all my ways are before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let my cry come before you, O Yahweh;
give me understanding according to your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let my plea come before you;
Deliver me according to your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let my lips pour out praise,
because you teach me your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let my tongue sing of your word,
because all your commands are right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let your hand be my help,
because I have chosen your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I long for your salvation, O Yahweh,
and your law is my delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let my soul live that it may praise you,
and let your ordinances help me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have wandered like a lost sheep; seek your servant,
because I do not forget your commands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In my distress I called to Yahweh,
and he answered me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Deliver my life, O Yahweh, from lying lips,
from a deceitful tongue.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What shall be given to you,
and what more shall be done to you,
deceitful tongue?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sharpened arrows of a warrior,
with burning charcoals from broom trees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe to me, that I sojourn in Meshech,
that I dwell among the tents of Kedar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Too long my soul has had its dwelling
near one who hates peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am for peace, but when I speak,
they are for war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I lift up my eyes to the mountains;
whence will my help come?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My help is from Yahweh,
maker of heaven and earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will not allow your foot to be moved;
he who protects you will not slumber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, he will not slumber and he will not sleep—
he who protects Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh is your protector;
Yahweh is your shade at your right hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sun will not strike you by day,
nor the moon by night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh will protect you from all evil;
he will protect your life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh will protect your going out and your coming in
from now until forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I rejoiced in those who said to me,
“Let us go to the house of Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our feet are standing
within your gates, O Jerusalem—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jerusalem that is built
as a city that is joined together,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
where the tribes go up,
the tribes of Yah as a testimony for Israel,
to give thanks to the name of Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For there the thrones sit for judgment,
thrones of David’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pray for the peace of Jerusalem:
“May those who love you be at ease.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May peace be within your walls,
security within your palaces.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the sake of my brothers and my friends,
I will say, “Peace be within you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the sake of the house of Yahweh our God,
I will seek your good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I lift up my eyes to you,
the one enthroned in the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, as the eyes of servants
look to the hand of their master,
as the eyes of a maid to the hand of her mistress,
so our eyes look to Yahweh our God,
until he is gracious to us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be gracious to us, O Yahweh, be gracious to us,
for long enough we have had our fill of contempt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For long enough our soul has had its fill of
the derision of the self-confident,
the contempt of the arrogant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If it had not been Yahweh who was on our side,”
do let Israel say,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If it had not been Yahweh who was on our side,
when men rose up against us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
then they would have swallowed us alive,
when their anger was kindled against us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the waters would have flooded over us,
the torrent would have passed over our soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then over our soul would have passed
the raging waters.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be Yahweh,
who has not made us prey for their teeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our soul has escaped like a bird
from the snare of fowlers.
The snare is broken, and we have escaped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our help is in the name of Yahweh,
maker of heaven and earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who trust in Yahweh
are like Mount Zion, which cannot be moved,
but abides forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As mountains are round about Jerusalem,
so Yahweh is round about his people,
from now until forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the scepter of wickedness shall not rest
on the land of the righteous,
lest the righteous stretch out
their hands to do wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do good, O Yahweh, to the good,
and to those upright in their hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But regarding those who turn aside to their crooked ways,
Yahweh will lead them away with the evildoers.
Peace be upon Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When Yahweh restored the fortunes of Zion,
we were like dreamers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then our mouth was filled with laughter,
and our tongue with rejoicing.
Then they said among the nations,
“Yahweh has done great things for these people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh has done great things for us;
we are glad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Restore, O Yahweh, our fortunes
like the streams in the Negeb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who sow with tears
shall reap with rejoicing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who diligently goes out with weeping,
carrying the seed bag,
shall certainly come in with rejoicing,
carrying his sheaves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Unless Yahweh builds a house,
its builders labor at it in vain.
Unless Yahweh guards a city,
a guard watches in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is in vain for you who rise early and sit late,
eating the bread of anxious toil,
when thus he provides for his beloved in his sleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, children are the heritage of Yahweh;
the fruit of the womb is a reward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like arrows in the hand of a warrior,
so are the children of one’s youth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed is the man who fills his quiver with them.
They shall not be put to shame
when they speak with enemies at the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed is everyone who fears Yahweh,
who walks in his ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will indeed eat of the labor of your hands;
you will be happy and it will be well with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your wife will be like a fruitful vine
within your house.
Your children will be like olive shoots
about your table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, for thus shall a man be blessed
who fears Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May Yahweh bless you from Zion,
that you may see the good of Jerusalem
all the days of your life,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and that you may see your children’s children.
May peace be upon Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Too often they have attacked me from my youth.”
Let Israel say,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Too often they have attacked me from my youth,
yet they have not prevailed against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On my back plowmen have plowed.
They have made their furrows long.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh is righteous.
He has cut the ropes of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let all be put to shame and repulsed
who hate Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them be like grass on the housetops,
that withers before it grows up,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
with which a reaper cannot fill his hand,
nor the binder of sheaves his arms,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so that passersby do not say,
“The blessing of Yahweh be upon you.
We bless you in the name of Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Out of the depths I call to you, O Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“O Lord, hear my voice.
Let your ears be attentive
to the voice of my supplications.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you, O Yah, should keep track of iniquities,
O Lord, who could stand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But with you is forgiveness,
so that you may be feared.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I await Yahweh; my soul awaits,
and I wait for his word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul waits for the Lord
more than watchmen for the morning.
Yes, more than watchmen for the morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Israel, wait for Yahweh.
For with Yahweh there is loyal love,
and with him there is abundant redemption.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he will redeem Israel
from all its iniquities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My heart is not haughty nor my eyes arrogant.
And I do not concern myself
with things too great and difficult for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rather I have soothed and quieted my soul,
like a weaned child with its mother,
like the weaned child is my soul with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Israel, hope in Yahweh
from now until forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Yahweh, remember with regard to David
all his affliction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How he swore to Yahweh,
he vowed to the Mighty One of Jacob:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will not enter into the tent of my house,
I will not go up to the couch of my bed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will give no sleep to my eyes,
no slumber to my eyelids,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
until I find a place for Yahweh,
a dwelling place for the Mighty One of Jacob.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, we heard of it in Ephrathah;
we found her in the fields of Jaar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let us go to his dwelling places;
Let us worship at his footstool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Arise, O Yahweh, to your resting place,
you and your mighty ark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let your priests clothe themselves with righteousness,
and let your faithful sing for joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the sake of your servant David,
do not turn away the face of your anointed one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh swore in truth to David;
he will not turn back from it.
“One from the fruit of your body
I will set on your throne.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If your sons will heed my covenant
and my testimonies that I will teach them,
their sons also forever
will sit on your throne.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For Yahweh has chosen Zion;
he has desired it for his habitation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“This is my resting place forever;
here I will dwell, for I have desired it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will bless its provisions abundantly;
I will satisfy its poor with bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will also clothe its priests with salvation,
and its faithful will shout exuberantly for joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There I will cause a horn to grow for David;
I will set a lamp for my anointed one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will clothe his enemies with shame,
but on him his crown will flourish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, how good and how pleasant it is
when brothers dwell together in unity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is like the fragrant oil upon the head,
running down upon the beard, the beard of Aaron,
that runs down upon the edges of his robes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is like the dew of Hermon that runs down
upon the mountains of Zion,
because there Yahweh commanded the blessing—
life forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, bless Yahweh, all you the servants of Yahweh,
who serve in the house of Yahweh by night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lift up your hands in the sanctuary
and bless Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May Yahweh bless you from Zion,
he who made heaven and earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise Yah! Praise the name of Yahweh.
Praise him, O servants of Yahweh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who stand in the house of Yahweh,
in the courts of the house of our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise Yah, for Yahweh is good.
Sing praises concerning his name, for it is pleasant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For Yah has chosen Jacob for himself,
Israel as his special possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I know that Yahweh is great,
and our Lord is greater than all gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All that Yahweh desires, he does,
in heaven and on earth,
in the seas and all the depths.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Who struck the firstborn of Egypt,
both of humans and animals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sent signs and wonders into your midst, O Egypt,
against Pharaoh and all his servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who struck many nations
and killed mighty kings—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sihon the king of the Amorites,
and Og the king of Bashan,
and all the kingdoms of Canaan—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and he gave their land as an inheritance,
an inheritance for his people Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Yahweh, your name endures forever,
your renown throughout all generations,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for Yahweh will plead the cause of his people
and will have compassion on his servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The idols of the nations are silver and gold,
the work of the hands of humankind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have mouths, but cannot speak;
they have eyes, but cannot see;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they have ears, but cannot hear;
there is not even breath in their mouths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who make them become like them,
as does everyone who trusts in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O house of Israel, bless Yahweh.
O house of Aaron, bless Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O house of Levi, bless Yahweh.
You who fear Yahweh, bless Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be Yahweh from Zion,
who dwells in Jerusalem. Praise Yah!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give thanks to Yahweh, for he is good,
for his loyal love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give thanks to the God of gods,
for his loyal love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give thanks to the Lord of lords,
for his loyal love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To him who alone does great wonders,
for his loyal love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To him who made the heavens with skill,
for his loyal love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To him who spread out the earth above the waters,
for his loyal love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To him who made the great lights,
for his loyal love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sun to rule the day,
for his loyal love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The moon and stars to rule the night,
for his loyal love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To him who struck Egypt through their firstborn,
for his loyal love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he brought Israel out from among them,
for his loyal love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With a strong hand and an outstretched arm,
for his loyal love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To him who divided the Red Sea in two,
for his loyal love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he let Israel cross over through the midst of it,
for his loyal love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But he tossed Pharaoh and his army into the Red Sea,
for his loyal love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To him who led his people through the wilderness,
for his loyal love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To him who struck great kings,
for his loyal love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he killed mighty kings,
for his loyal love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sihon the king of the Amorites,
for his loyal love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And Og the king of Bashan,
for his loyal love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he gave their land as an inheritance,
for his loyal love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An inheritance to Israel his servant,
for his loyal love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who remembered us in our low estate,
for his loyal love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he rescued us from our enemies,
for his loyal love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The one who gives food to all flesh,
for his loyal love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give thanks to the God of heaven,
for his loyal love endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By the rivers of Babylon,
there we sat, yes, we wept,
when we remembered Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On the willows in her midst,
we hung up our lyres.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For there our captors asked of us
words of a song,
and our tormentors asked of us jubilation,
“Sing for us from a song of Zion.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How could we sing the song of Yahweh
in a foreign land?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I forget you, O Jerusalem,
let my right hand forget.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let my tongue cling to the roof of my mouth,
if I do not remember you,
if do not I exalt Jerusalem
above my highest joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember, O Yahweh, against the sons of Edom
the day of Jerusalem,
the ones who said, “Lay it bare! Lay it bare
to its foundation!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O daughter of Babylon, about to be devastated,
happy shall be he who pays back to you
what you paid out to us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Happy shall be he who seizes
and smashes your children
against the rock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I give you thanks with my whole heart;
before the gods I sing your praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I bow down toward your holy temple
and give thanks to your name,
because of your loyal love and faithfulness,
for you have magnified your word according to all your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I called and you answered me,
you emboldened me in my soul with strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the kings of the earth
will praise you, O Yahweh,
when they have heard the words of your mouth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and they will sing of the ways of Yahweh,
because Yahweh’s glory is great.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though Yahweh is high, yet he sees the lowly,
but the proud he perceives at a distance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though I walk in the midst of trouble,
you preserve me alive.
You stretch out your hand against the anger of my enemies,
and you save me with your right hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: O Yahweh, you have searched me, and you know me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You know my sitting down and my rising up.
You understand my thought from afar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You search out my wandering and my lying down,
and are acquainted with all my ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For there is not a word yet on my tongue,
but behold, O Yahweh, you know it completely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You barricade me behind and in front,
and set your hand upon me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Such knowledge is too wonderful for me.
It is set high; I cannot prevail against it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Where I can go from your Spirit,
or where can I flee from your presence?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I ascend to heaven, there you are,
and if I make my bed in Sheol, look! There you are.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I lift up the wings of the dawn,
and I alight on the far side of the sea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
even there your hand would lead me,
and your right hand would hold me fast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And if I should say, “Surely darkness will cover me,
and the light around me will be as night,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
even the darkness is not too dark for you,
and the night shines as the day—
the darkness and the light are alike for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed you created my inward parts;
you wove me in my mother’s womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I praise you, because I am fearfully
and wonderfully made.
Wonderful are your works,
and my soul knows it well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My frame was not hidden from you,
when I was created secretly,
and intricately woven
in the depths of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your eyes saw my embryo,
and in your book they all were written—
days fashioned for me when there was not one of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And to me, how precious are your thoughts, O God;
how vast is their sum.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I should count them,
they would outnumber the sand.
I awaken, and I am still with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If only you would kill the wicked, O God—
so get away from me, you bloodthirsty men—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who speak against you deceitfully.
Your enemies take your name in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do I not hate those who hate you, O Yahweh?
And do I not loathe those who rise up against you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I hate them with a complete hatred;
they have become my enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Search me, O God, and know my heart;
test me and know my anxious thoughts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And see if there is in me the worship of false gods,
and lead me in the way everlasting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rescue me, O Yahweh, from evil men.
Preserve me from violent men,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who plan evil things in their heart.
They stir up wars continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They sharpen their tongue as sharp as a snake’s;
the venom of a viper is under their lips. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Protect me, O Yahweh, from the hands of the wicked.
Preserve me from violent men,
who have planned to make me stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The proud have hidden a trap for me, and cords.
They have spread out a net along the side of the path.
They have set snares for me. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I say to Yahweh, “You are my God.”
Listen, O Yahweh, to the voice of my supplications.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Yahweh, my Lord, the strength of my salvation,
you have covered my head in the day of battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not grant, O Yahweh, the desires of the wicked.
Do not allow them to attain their plan, lest they be exalted. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With respect to the head of those who surround me,
may the harm of their lips cover them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Do not let a slanderer be established in the land;
as for the man of violence, let evil hunt him quickly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I know that Yahweh will maintain the cause of the afflicted,
and justice for the needy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely the righteous will give thanks to your name;
the upright will dwell in your presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I call on you, O Yahweh; hasten to me.
Listen to my voice when I call to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let my prayer be set before you as incense,
the lifting up of my palms as the evening offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Set a guard, O Yahweh, over my mouth;
keep watch over the door of my lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not incline my heart to any evil thing,
to practice wicked deeds
with men who do iniquity;
and do not let me eat of their delicacies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let a righteous one strike me in kindness,
and let him chasten me.
It is oil for my head; let not my head refuse.
For still my prayer is against their evil deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When their judges are thrown down the sides of a cliff,
then they will understand that my words were pleasant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As when one plows and breaks up the earth,
so our bones are scattered at the mouth of Sheol.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But my eyes are toward you, O Yahweh, my Lord;
I have taken refuge in you. Do not lay bare my soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Protect me from the grasp of the trap they have laid for me,
and from the snares of evildoers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the wicked fall into their nets,
while I escape altogether.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I cry out with my voice to Yahweh;
I implore favor with my voice to Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I pour out my complaint before him;
I declare my trouble before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When my spirit faints within me,
you know my way.
On the path where I walk,
they have hidden a trap for me;
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I cry out to you, O Yahweh.
I say, “You are my refuge,
my portion in the land of the living.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Attend to my cry,
for I am brought very low.
Deliver me from my pursuers,
for they are stronger than I.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bring me out of prison,
that I may give thanks to your name.
The righteous will encircle me,
because you will deal bountifully with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Yahweh, hear my prayer;
listen to my supplications.
In your faithfulness answer me,
and in your righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And do not enter into judgment with your servant,
because no one alive is righteous before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the enemy has pursued my soul;
he has crushed my life to the ground.
He has made me dwell in dark places
like those long dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And so my spirit grows faint within me;
my heart within me is desolate.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I stretch out my hands to you;
my soul longs for you like a dry land. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Quickly answer me, O Yahweh;
my spirit fails.
Do not hide your face from me,
or I will become
like those descending to the pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cause me to hear your loyal love in the morning,
for I trust you.
Cause me to know the way that I should go,
for I lift up my soul to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver me from my enemies, O Yahweh.
I take refuge in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For your name’s sake, O Yahweh, preserve my life;
in your righteousness bring me out of trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And in your loyal love destroy my enemies,
and exterminate all the adversaries of my soul,
for I am your servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be Yahweh, my rock,
the one who trains my hands for battle,
my fingers for war—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
my loyal love and my fortress,
my stronghold and my deliverer,
my shield, and one in whom I take refuge,
the one who subdues peoples under me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Yahweh, what is humankind that you take knowledge of him,
or the son of man that you take thought of him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Humankind is like a breath,
his days like a passing shadow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Yahweh, bow the heavens and come down;
touch the mountains so that they smoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Flash forth lightning and scatter them;
dispatch your arrows and rout them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
whose mouth speaks falsely,
and their right hand is a false right hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O God, I will sing a new song to you.
With a lyre of ten strings I will sing praise to you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who gives victory to kings,
who rescues David his servant
from the evil sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rescue me and deliver me
from the hand of foreigners,
whose mouth speaks falsely,
and whose right hand is a false right hand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that our sons may be like plants,
full grown in their youth,
our daughters like corner pillars,
carved in the style of a palace,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that our granaries may be full,
providing produce of all kinds,
that our sheep may produce by the thousands,
by the tens of thousands in our open fields,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that our cattle may be pregnant;
that there be no breach in our walls,
and no going out in exile,
and no outcry in our plazas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed are the people who have it thus.
Blessed are the people whose God is Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will exalt you, my God, O king,
and I will bless your name forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Every day I will bless you
and praise your name forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Great is Yahweh, and very worthy of praise,
and his greatness is unsearchable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One generation will laud your works to another,
and will declare your mighty deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On the splendor of the glory of your majesty,
and on your wonderful deeds, I will meditate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they will speak of the power of your awesome deeds,
and I will tell of your greatness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will utter the renown of your abundant goodness,
and they will proclaim with joy your righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh is gracious and compassionate,
slow to anger and great in loyal love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh is good to all,
and his mercies are over all his works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All your works will praise you, O Yahweh,
and your faithful ones will bless you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will speak of the glory of your kingdom,
and talk of your power,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to make known to the children of humankind his mighty deeds,
and the glory of the majesty of his kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your kingdom is an everlasting kingdom,
and your dominion endures throughout all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh upholds all who are falling,
and raises up all who are bowed down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The eyes of all look hopefully to you,
and you give them their food in due time,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
opening your hand,
and satisfying the desire of every living creature.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh is righteous in all his ways,
and loyal in all his works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh is near to all who call on him,
to all who call on him in truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He fulfills the desire of those who fear him;
he also hears their cry for help, and saves them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh protects all those who love him,
but all the wicked he will exterminate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My mouth will speak the praise of Yahweh,
and all flesh will bless his holy name
forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise Yah.
Praise Yahweh, O my soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will praise Yahweh while I live;
I will sing praises to my God while I am still alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not place trust in princes,
in a son of humankind with whom there is no deliverance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His breath departs; he returns to his plot;
on that day his plans perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed is the one whose help is the God of Jacob,
whose hope is on Yahweh as his God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who made heaven and earth,
the sea and all that is in them,
the one who keeps faith forever,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh protects the strangers.
He helps up the orphan and the widow,
but the way of the wicked he thwarts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh will reign forever,
Your God, O Zion, throughout all generations.
Praise Yah.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh is building Jerusalem;
he gathers the scattered ones of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He is the one who heals the brokenhearted,
and binds up their wounds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He counts the number of the stars;
he gives names to all of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Great is our Lord, and abundant in power;
his understanding is unlimited.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh helps the afflicted up;
he brings the wicked down to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to Yahweh with thanksgiving;
sing praises to our God with lyre,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who covers the heavens with clouds,
who provides rain for the earth,
who causes grass to grow on the mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He gives to the animal its food,
and to the young ravens that cry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He does not delight in the strength of the horse;
he takes no pleasure in the legs of the man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh takes pleasure in those who fear him,
the ones who hope for his loyal love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Laud Yahweh, O Jerusalem;
praise your God, O Zion,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for he strengthens the bars of your gates.
He blesses your children within you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he makes your border peaceful;
he satisfies you with the finest of wheat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sends out his command to the earth;
his word runs swiftly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He gives snow like wool;
he scatters frost like ashes;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he throws his hail like crumbs.
Who can stand before his cold?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sends out his word and melts them;
he blows his breath, the water flows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He declares his word to Jacob,
his statutes and his ordinances to Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has not done so for any nation,
and they do not know his ordinances.
Praise Yah.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Praise him, all his angels;
praise him, all his hosts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise him, sun and moon;
praise him, all stars of light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise him, highest heavens,
and waters above the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them praise the name of Yahweh,
because he commanded and they were created.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he put them in place forever and ever,
by a decree he gave that will not pass away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise Yahweh from the earth—
great sea creatures and all deeps,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
fire and hail, snow and cloud,
stormy wind doing his bidding,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the mountains and all hills,
fruit trees and all cedars,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
beasts and all cattle,
creeping things and flying birds,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
kings of the earth and all peoples,
princes and all judges of the earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
young men and young women as well,
the old together with the young—
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And he has raised high a horn for his people,
praise for all his faithful—
for the children of Israel,
a people close to him.
Praise Yah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise Yah.
Sing to Yahweh a new song,
his praise in the assembly of the faithful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let Israel be glad in its maker;
let the children of Zion rejoice in their king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them praise his name with dancing;
let them sing praises to him with tambourine and lyre.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For Yahweh takes pleasure in his people;
he glorifies the afflicted with salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the faithful exult in glory;
let them sing for joy on their beds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the extolling of God be in their throat,
and a double-edged sword in their hand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to execute vengeance on the nations
and punishment on the peoples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to bind their kings with chains
and their nobles with fetters of iron,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Praise him for his mighty deeds;
praise him according to the abundance of his greatness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise him with blast of horn;
praise him with harp and lyre.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise him with tambourine and dancing;
praise him with strings and flute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise him with sounding cymbals;
praise him with clashing cymbals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Every breathing thing,
let it praise Yah.
Praise Yah.
verses.speaker: Narrator
